intro: Lycianthes biflora subsp. macrodon, commonly known as the large-fruited morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in the early morning. The plant produces distinctive, elongated fruits that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically significant in its native habitats.
